intro: Meriania paniculata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved meriania, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and clusters of showy, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
